text:
Hi, my name is Balaji Palanisamy
and I am a Principal with AWS
Cloud Governance services.

Here at AWS, I am part of a team
that helps customers achieve

business value from their cloud
investments through effective
cloud governance.

Before joining AWS, I was an executive
advisor guiding organizations

through transformative
security, risk, and compliance
programs.

I now engage with customer
executives leading risk management

and compliance programs
to refresh their approach

to risk and compliance
in the cloud.

I guide them with best practices
and lessons learned to accelerate

their organization's
digital transformation
journey.

Cloud computing is the on-demand
delivery of IT resources

over the internet with pay-as-you-go
pricing.

Rather than purchasing
and maintaining your own servers

and data centers, with the cloud
you can access IT resources

on demand as a service and pay
only for what you use.

Chief Compliance Officers,
also known as CCOs and Chief

Risk Officers, or CROs care
a lot about the cloud for the
following three reasons.

First, the business units you
support see the cloud as an opportunity

to differentiate their business
and transform customer experiences.

Using the cloud, you can provision
IT resources in minutes,

and put them together in configurations
that you want.

Your organization can now implement
ideas quickly by removing

time-consuming IT procurement
steps.

Additionally, the cloud provides
quick access to technologies,

such as data analytics,
that take advantage of artificial

intelligence and machine
learning, so executives
can make better decisions.

Second, your governance,
risk, and compliance (also

known as GRC) functions
can leverage the cloud to meet

the demand for speed and agility
brought about by cloud powered
teams.

Regardless of industry,
GRC teams typically don't have

enough people to do all the things
they need to do.

These teams are challenged
to stay ahead of fast-changing

regulations, industry standards,
reporting requirements,
and emerging threats.

The cloud empowers GRC leaders
to scale small teams through

the myriad managed security
services, additional visibility,
and automation capabilities.

Finally, you can build on the
compliance certifications

and security controls that are
already there.

AWS supports 98 security
standards and compliance

certifications, including
PCI DSS, HIPAA, HITECH, FedRAMP,
and many others.

This is possible because
our core infrastructure

is built to satisfy the security
requirements of the military,

global banks, and other highly
sensitive organizations.

Customers can also build their
own controls using the deep

set of cloud security tools
with over 300 security,

compliance, and governance
services and features.
